q: the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies.`` I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped,'' said Ken Auletta , author of Googled: The End of the World As We Know It. `` I think Eric Schmidt is burned out.'' The memo follows a number of recent high-profile interventions from Ed Miliband in the phone-hacking issue. Bernie Sanders said he would like to hear a stronger pledge from Barack Obama . Jeb Hensarling of Texas said- and he's the Republican Conference chairman- that they're going to take Rand Paul Ryan's blueprint and use it, said Chuck Schumer .`` That's privatizing Medicare.... They're going to do the same for Social Security.`` Their agenda: Privatize both programs, which means end them,'' said Chuck Schumer .

`` he jumped'' and`` won't stay that long'' at the company. He Was Pushed Eric Schmidt stepping down creates a`` huge advantage'' for Google, writes Danny Sullivan at Search Engine Land. If Page is stepping up as the public face, it's an opportunity to defuse or put some of the gaffes associated with Eric Schmidt behind the company. Page carries virtually no such baggage. MG Siegler at TechCrunch also thinks the departure was forced.`` This is clearly Eric Schmidt being removed from power,'' he writes.`` It appears to be because things just weren't getting done the

all know what you do, right?'' Adam Sandler responded with a joke that spiralled into a pretty odd place rather quickly.`` My mother still thinks I'm a doctor,'' he quipped. I never really told her. So every Thanksgiving her friends will come over and I'll give them pelvic exams. Conan O'Brien Adam Sandler on` David Letterman ' after the jump! Now why was it necessary to in three sentences get to examining senior citizen pelvises, and his mother's friends in particular? David Letterman summed it

in a company blog post that the decade-old Google troika of himself, Mr. Page and Mr. Eric Schmidt had worked well in guiding the company to its current perch atop search and growing power elsewhere. But he added: We have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. More informally, Mr. Eric Schmidt delivered this message on Twitter:`` Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!''
